name: Text
desc: Properties shared by all text component types.

items.name: role
items.desc: The role of a text component depends on the type of content it contains. For example, a PullQuote should have a role of pullquote, and for text in the article body, the role should be body. See Component.

items.name: text
items.desc: The text to display in the article, including any formatting tags depending on the format property. You can also use a subset of HTML tags or Markdown syntax by setting format to html or markdown, respectively. See Using HTML with Apple News Format. Alternatively, you can style ranges of text individually using the InlineTextStyle object.

items.name: additions
items.desc: An array of all the additions that should be applied to ranges of the component's text.Additions are ignored when format is set to html or markdown.

items.name: anchor
items.desc: An object that defines vertical alignment with another component.

items.name: animation
items.desc: An object that defines an animation to be applied to the component.The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.

items.name: behavior
items.desc: An object that defines behavior for a component, like Parallax or Springy.The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.

items.name: conditional
items.desc: An instance or array of text component properties that can be applied conditionally, and the conditions that cause them to be applied.

items.name: format
items.desc: The formatting or markup method applied to the text. If format is set to html or markdown, neither Additions nor InlineTextStyles are supported.

items.name: hidden
items.desc: A Boolean value that determines whether the component is hidden.

items.name: identifier
items.desc: An optional unique identifier for this component. If used, this identifier must be unique across the entire document. You will need an identifier for your component if you want to anchor other components to it.

items.name: inlineTextStyles
items.desc: An array of InlineTextStyle objects you can use to apply different text styles to ranges of text. For each InlineTextStyle, you should supply a rangeStart, rangeLength, and either a text style or the identifier of a text style that is defined at the top level of the document.InlineTextStyles are ignored when format is set to html or markdown.The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.

items.name: layout
items.desc: An inline ComponentLayout object that contains layout information, or a string reference to a ComponentLayout that is defined at the top level of the document. If layout is not defined, size and position are based on various factors, such as the device type, the length of the content, and the role of this component.

items.name: style
items.desc: An inline ComponentStyle object that defines the appearance of this component, or a string reference to a ComponentStyle object that is defined at the top level of the document.The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.

items.name: textStyle
items.desc: An inline ComponentTextStyle object that contains styling information, or a string reference to a ComponentTextStyle object that is defined at the top level of the document.
